description.narrative:
Strategic Partnership Project- Phase Two
Phase two of Strategic Partnership project is planned for two years with an overall budget of Euro #629.747 (80% partners and 20% Oxfam) which lies under Conflict <(>&<)> Fragility theme of Oxfam Novib, SP project isfunded by Ministry of Foreign Affair (MoFA) of the Netherlands and lead by Oxfam Novib in The Hague.
The official starting date of SP IIproject is 1st January 2019 and the end date is 31st December 2020. Its implementing partner is an Afghan local organization by thename of Peace, Training and Research Organization (PTRO).
The desired impact level change of this project is to hold the government and informal authorities accountable to implement effective policies and mechanisms for inclusion; andvoices and needs of Afghan women affected by conflict are represented at sub- national and international levels to enhance protection of women in public spaces and prevent gender-based violence.
Its overall objective is to contribute and monitoring the implementation of the Afghan National Action Plan 1325 on Pillars 2 (protection).
Out of seven global objectives of Strategic Partnership project, SP Afghanistan cover#sbelow objectives for the second phase:
# Improved policies - Governments <(>&<)> Global Actors # Strengthened CSOs # Increased political will # Stronger and wider alliances
The Methodology for its implementation of the project is: a) Bottom-up engagement with relevant social and political actors at the local level to monitor whetherthe NAP has been implemented in a sufficient and effective manner to meet the needs of women and girls. b) Assisting the government with the provision of adequate protection, and sufficient economic resources for women in conflict and post-conflict situations as a pre-requisite for women#s access to education and healthcare.
Strategic partnership is a complementary project with other programs of Oxfam in Afghanistan as such (Bayan II : inclusive governance and improved security through influencing (2014-2016): Project under the second Netherlands NAP 1325), (Citizens First: Improving Human Security in Afghanistan and Pakistan (2012-2016)) and (NAP III: contributing to and monitoring the implementation of NAP 1325 pillar one (protection) and pillar three (Prevention) ongoing project funded by Dutch MoFA (Nov 2016- Dec 2019).
SP project isimplemented in six provinces of Afghanistan: Nangrahar, Takhar, Balkh, Daikundi, Herat and Kabul
PTRO works through established structures of the previous projects of Oxfam called: Provincial Advocacy Committees (PAC) and National Advocacy Committees (NAC).
The project outcomes are listed below: Targeted Outcome 1: By 2020, the thematic and operational capacity of 30 Afghan CSOs (includingWomen´s Organizations) enhanced; and their engagement in advocacy trajectories and monitoring through stronger alliances continued so as to hold the Afghan government accountable on its commitments to pillar 2 (protection) as stated in the NAP 1325 adopted in June 2015.
Targeted Outcome 2: By 2020, government officials of relevant ministries have increased their awareness and capacity to 1)implement policies and practices related to Pillar 2 (protection) and 2) are increasingly engaged with grassroots CSOs on theseissues.
Targeted Outcome 3: By 2020, the CSOs and WOs involved in this Program, have become structurally involved in the monitoring of the proper implementation of pillar 2 of the NAP 1325, through increased number of men along with women advocating for women#s and girls# rights in the target areas, and through more effective monitoring and advocacy mechanisms that foster both critical and constructive engagement with the relevant authorities at Provincial and National level.
Targeted Outcome 4: By2020, the CSOs/ WOs and Ministry of Women Affairs and the Gender Units of signatory ministries involved in this Program, have become structurally engaged with the monitoring of the proper implementation of pillar 2 (Protection) of NAP 1325, through increased number of men and women advocating for women#s and girls# rights in the target areas, and through more effective monitoring and advocacy mechanisms that foster both critical and constructive engagement with the relevant authorities at National level.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam works to help poor and marginalized people to gain control over their own lives by exercising their right to political participation, freedom of expression and information, freedom of assembly, and access to justice. Many projects currently being executed by Oxfam in Afghanistan on women and youth fall under this campaign.
In Afghanistan, ON has been working with local NGOs, civil society organisations and networks through a number of initiatives to raise awareness about human rights, promote women's participation and leadership, and empower citizens to speak out on issues that affect their lives and to improve governance

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
